org.odk.collect.android.utilities

Interface ScreenContext

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    FormEntryActivity

    public interface ScreenContext
    An object that holds both a FragmentActivity and a LifecycleOwner that represents the lifecycle of a View. This can be useful when views needing a LifecycleOwner reference (for use with LiveData for example) have a "lifecycle" that is separate from their parent Activity or Fragment. These views would ideally be contained in a Fragment that can determine their lifecycle but in cases where that isn't possible ScreenContext can provide a polyfill.

    The simplest way to use ScreenContext is have a view's parent Activity implement it so the view can access it from its Context reference like so:

    public class MyView { <p> private final ScreenContext screenContext; <p> public MyView(Context context) { this.screenContext = (ScreenContext) context; } }

      androidx.lifecycle.LifecycleOwner getViewLifecycle()
